sen.j: 自玉手祭来酒解神社（たまでよりまつりきたるさかとけじんじゃ）は京都府乙訓郡大山崎町にある神社。
sen.e: Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni County, Kyoto Prefecture.
Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni County, Kyoto Prefecture.
Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 通称酒解神社（さかとけじんじゃ、さかときじんじゃ）。
sen.e: It is commonly referred to as Sakatoke-jinja or Sakatoki-jinja.
It is commonly referred to as Sakatoke-jinja or Sakatoki-jinja.
It is commonly referred to as Sakatoke-jinja or Sakatoki-jinja.

sen.j: 天王山の頂上近くに鎮座する。
sen.e: The shrine is situated near the summit of Mt. Tennozan.
The shrine is situated near the summit of Mt. Tennozan.
The shrine is situated near the summit of Mt. Tenno.

sen.j: 式内社（名神大社）で、旧社格は郷社。
sen.e: It was listed in the Register of Deities of the Engishiki and was ranked as a Gosha under the old shrine classification system.
It was listed in the Register of Deities of the Engishiki and was ranked as a Gosha under the old shrine classification system.
It was listed in the Register of Deities of the Engishiki and was ranked as a Gosha under the old shrine classification system.

sen.j: 祭神
sen.cmt: 文頭のみ大文字スペル

sen.j: 大山祇神を主祭神とし、スサノオを相殿に祀る。
sen.e: The main deity Oyamazumi-no-kami is enshrined along with Susanoo.
The main deity Oyamazumi-no-kami is enshrined along with Susanoo.
The main deity Oyamazumi-no-kami is enshrined along with Susanoo.

sen.j: 元々の祭神は山崎神・酒解神で、出自は不明であるが橘氏の先祖神であると言われている。
sen.e: The deities originally enshrined were Yamazakino-kami and Sakatokeno-kami and their origins are unclear but they are said to be ancestor gods of the Tachibana clan.
The deities originally enshrined were Yamazakino-kami and Sakatokeno-kami and their origins are unclear but they are said to be ancestor gods of the Tachibana clan.
The deities originally enshrined were Yamazakino-kami and Sakatokeno-kami and their origins are unclear but they are said to be ancestor gods of the Tachibana clan.

sen.j: 素盞嗚尊は、旧天神八王子社の祭神・牛頭天王を、神仏分離にともない改めたものである。
sen.e: Susanoono-mikoto became the Shinto kami representation of the Gozuteno, the enshrined deity of the former Tenjin Hachiojisha Shrine, following the separation of Buddhism and Shintoism.
Susanoono-mikoto became the Shinto kami representation of the Gozuteno, the enshrined deity of the former Tenjin Hachiojisha Shrine, following the separation of Buddhism and Shintoism.
Susanoono-mikoto became the Shinto kami representation of the Gozuteno, the enshrined deity of the former Tenjin Hachiojisha Shrine, following the separation of Buddhism and Shintoism.

sen.j: 歴史
創建の由緒は不詳であるが、養老元年（717年）建立の棟札があることから奈良時代の創建とみられている。
sen.e: The details of the shrine's founding are unclear but it is known from the munafuda plaque attached to the building placing its construction at the year 717 that it was established during the Nara period.

The details of the shrine's founding are unclear but it is known from the munafuda plaque attached to the building placing its construction at the year 717 that it was established during the Nara period.

The details of the shrine's founding are unclear but it is known from the munafuda plaque attached to the building placing its construction at the year 717 that it was established during the Nara period.

sen.j: 旧名を山埼杜といい、現在の離宮八幡宮の地に祀られていた。
sen.e: It was formerly known as Yamazaki-sha Shrine and is now located on the site of Rikyu Hachiman-gu Shrine.
It was formerly known as Yamazaki-sha Shrine and is now located on the site of Rikyu Hachiman-gu Shrine.
It was formerly known as Yamazaki-sha Shrine and was located on the site of current Rikyu Hachiman-gu Shrine.

sen.j: 平安時代の延喜式神名帳には「山城国乙訓郡 自玉手祭来酒解神社 元名山埼杜」と記載され、官幣名神大社に列し、月次、新嘗の幣帛に預ると記されている。
sen.e: The Shinmyo Cho (Register of Deities) of the Engishiki (procedures of the Engi era) published in the Heian period describes the shrine as "Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine located in Otokuni County, Yamashiro Province and originally named Yamazaki-sha Shrine", classifies it as a Kanpei Myojin Taisha Shrine, and records that offerings of cloth, rope or paper are made monthly and during the Niiname festival.

The Shinmyo Cho (Register of Deities) of the Engishiki (procedures of the Engi era) published in the Heian period describes the shrine as "Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine located in Otokuni County, Yamashiro Province and originally named Yamazaki-sha Shrine", classifies it as a Kanpei Myojin Taisha Shrine, and records that offerings of cloth, rope or paper are made monthly and during the Niiname festival.

The Shinmyo Cho (Register of Deities) of the Engishiki (procedures of the Engi era) published in the Heian period describes the shrine as 'Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine located in Otokuni County, Yamashiro Province and originally named Yamazaki-sha Shrine,' classifies it as a Kanpei Myojin Taisha Shrine, and records that offerings of cloth, rope or paper are made monthly and during the Niiname festival.

sen.j: その後、自玉手祭來酒解神社の祭祀は途絶え、明治時代まで所在がわからなくなっていた。
sen.e: Following this time, there are no records of rites and festivals held at Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine, and its location remains unknown until the Meiji era.
Following this time, there are no records of rites and festivals held at Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine, and its location remains unknown until the Meiji era.
Following this time, there are no records of rites and festivals held at Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine, and its location remains unknown until the Meiji period.

sen.j: 現在の自玉手祭来酒解神社は、天王山の頂上近くに中世ごろよりあった天神八王子神（牛頭天王）を祀る「山崎天王社」であった。
sen.e: The current Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine was formerly the "Yamazaki Tenno-sha Shrine" that enshrined Tenjin Hachioji (Gozuteno) and stood near to the summit of Mt. Tennozan since the middle ages.

The current Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine was formerly the "Yamazaki Tenno-sha Shrine" that enshrined Tenjin Hachioji (Gozuteno) and stood near to the summit of Mt. Tennozan since the middle ages.

The current Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine was formerly the 'Yamazaki Tenno-sha Shrine' that enshrined Tenjin Hachioji (Gozuteno) and stood near to the summit of Mt. Tenno since the middle ages.

sen.j: 天王山は元は山崎山と呼んでいたが、当社にちなんで天王山と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: Mt. Tennozan was originally called Mt. Yamazakisan but renamed Mt. Tennozan after this shrine.
Mt. Tennozan was originally called Mt. Yamazakisan but renamed Mt. Tennozan after this shrine.
Mt. Tenno was originally called Mt. Yamazaki but renamed Mt. Tenno after this shrine.

sen.j: 明治10年6月、山崎天王社が式内・自玉手祭来酒解神社であるとされ、自玉手祭来酒解神社に改称した。
sen.e: In the 6th month of the 10th year of the Meiji era (1877), Yamazaki Tenno-sha Shrine was determined to be the Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine referred to in the Engishiki Shinmyo Cho and renamed Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine accordingly.

In the 6th month of the 10th year of the Meiji era (1877), Yamazaki Tenno-sha Shrine was determined to be the Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine referred to in the Engishiki Shinmyo Cho and renamed Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine accordingly.

In June 1877, Yamazaki Tenno-sha Shrine was determined to be the Tamadeyori Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine referred to in the Engishiki Shinmyo Cho and renamed Matsurikitaru Sakatoke-jinja Shrine accordingly.

sen.j: 現在の祭神・大山祇神はそのときに定められたものである。
sen.e: Oyamazumi-no-kami, the deity currently enshrined at the shrine, was installed at that time.
Oyamazumi-no-kami, the deity currently enshrined at the shrine, was installed at that time.
Oyamazumi-no-kami, the deity currently enshrined at the shrine, was installed at that time.

sen.j: 神輿庫は国の重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: The shinyoko (storehouse for portable shrines) is a nationally designated cultural property.
The shinyoko (storehouse for portable shrines) is a nationally designated cultural property.
The shinyoko (storehouse for portable shrines) is a nationally designated cultural property.

sen.j: 文化財
神輿庫 - 国の重要文化財、鎌倉時代建立の板倉
sen.e: Shinyoko (storehouse for portable shrines): Nationally designated cultural property; wooden-board storehouse constructed during the Kamakura period
Shinyoko (storehouse for portable shrines): Nationally designated cultural property; wooden-board storehouse constructed during the Kamakura period
Shinyoko (storehouse for portable shrines): Nationally designated cultural property; wooden-board storehouse constructed during the Kamakura period

sen.j: 神輿（2基） - 室町時代以前の作
sen.e: Mikoshi (portable shrines) (2): Constructed during the Muromachi period
Mikoshi (portable shrines) (2): Constructed during the Muromachi period
Mikoshi (portable shrines) (2): Constructed during the Muromachi period or before

sen.j: 摂末社
sen.cmt: 文頭のみ大文字スペル

sen.j: 後見社（大国主）
宮主社（アシナヅチ・テナヅチ）

行事
例祭 - 5月3日～5日（神輿の巡行は隔年の5月5日）
sen.e: Annual festival: From May 3rd to 5th (portable shrine parade takes place on May 5th of every other year)
Annual festival: From May 3rd to 5th (portable shrine parade takes place on May 5th of every other year)
Annual festival: From May 3 to 5 (portable shrine parade takes place on May 5 of every other year)

sen.j: 年越祭 - 12月31日
交通アクセス
阪急京都本線 大山崎駅 徒歩40分
sen.e: 40 minutes walk from Oyamazaki Station on the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line.
40 minutes walk from Oyamazaki Station on the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line.

sen.e: 40 minutes walk from Yamazaki Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the JR Kyoto Line.
